posts.post_content:
This card is probably one of the most extreme forms of control available. Your opponent has no cards to play during your turn and only 1 during their turn unless they've got draw boosters or whatever.
  
   
   
It's cool and fun to use but it's an effective time bomb if it isn't returned to your hand soon. If it is returned to your hand, it can be seen as 10 mana for XXXXX discard on your opponent and 7 card draw plus the mana of an unsummon.
  
   
   
Otherwise, one's deck needs to be full of something useful, something worth all this advantage and guarantee of no counters. It won't stop their creatures on the field but it provides a clear shot for burn if you're running UB with this thing for some reason, A spire chancellor would be better because of it's Chandra-esque enter the battlefield effect, or if you're running a mill deck where the aforementioned chancellor would still be much more effecti... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Fun, flavorful, and unique, but I'd have preferred it if he had 5 toughness to put him out of [burn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=193648) range. Of course since he's blue, it shouldn't be hard to protect him should he hit the field, but I'd have a hard time every playing this against any deck with red for fear of losing my 10 mana investment to a 1 CMC common. (For some reason, it just seems more insulting to get him burned for 4 than to have him hit with [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) or [Go For the Throat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Go For the Throat).)  
  
Then again, even if he had 5 toughness, he'd still be susceptible to [Artillerize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Artillerize), and the to-be-reprinted-in-M12 [Goblin Grenade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Grenade).
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
I just realized each of the Praetors seems to have a "signature spell", a la the M11 planeswalkers.  
  
Elesh Norn - [Norn's Annex](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Norn's Annex)  
Jin-Gitaxias - [Gitaxian Probe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gitaxian Probe)  
Sheoldred - [Reaper of Sheoldred](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reaper of Sheoldred)  
Urabrask - [Priest of Urabrask](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Priest of Urabrask)  
Vorinclex - this is the iffy one. Unlike the other four, nothing else in the block has his name in it ... but guess which green sorcery showed up in Mirrodin Beseiged that actually **shows** Vorinclex in its art?  
  
That's right. [Praetors' Counsel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Praetors' Counsel).
posts.html:
I just realized each of the Praetors seems to have a "signature spell", a la the M11 planeswalkers.

Elesh Norn - Norn's Annex
Jin-Gitaxias - Gitaxian Probe
Sheoldred - Reaper of Sheoldred
Urabrask - Priest of Urabrask
Vorinclex - this is the iffy one. Unlike the other four, nothing else in the block has his name in it ... but guess which green sorcery showed up in Mirrodin Beseiged that actually shows Vorinclex in its art?

That's right. Praetors' Counsel.

posts.post_content:
Absolutely the best card I have seen yet.  
  
Threw him in my deck with my [Lighthouse Chronologist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lighthouse Chronologist), [Rite of Replication](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Replication), [High Tide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=High Tide), [Reminisce](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reminisce), and [Time Stop](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Stop).  
  
Yes, that's right...  
  
To one of your turns I take seven, and each seven-turn cycle takes me through all my spells and puts it back for the next cycle. Meanwhile, you have nothing to use against me, and even if you did, your turn ends as soon as I tell it to. And, yes, I take *seven more*.  
  
This is why I play blue. 5/5
posts.html:

This is why I play blue. 5/5

Posted By: Justice1337 (9/15/2011 2:47:52 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card represents everything blue is supposed to be: a thirst for knowledge so obsessive-compulsive you could drown in it if you're not careful.  
  
A sadistic way to win with this card that I really prefer is using [Zedruu the Greathearted](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zedruu the Greathearted) or some similar donate effect to donate Jin-Gitaxias (and however many [Thought Reflection](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thought Reflection)s you've decided to put into play) and watch your opponent mill himself via card draw. Using Zedruu's card draw plus [Solitary Confinement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Solitary Confinement), your opponent can't really utilize the benefits you're giving him. Your pick of a [Jester's Cap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jester's Cap) type effect can be used beforehand to remove any possible graveyard recycling.  
  
Terribly inefficient way to do things, really, but it's an amazing 'win more' feeling if you can pull it off.
posts.html:
This card represents everything blue is supposed to be: a thirst for knowledge so obsessive-compulsive you could drown in it if you're not careful.

A sadistic way to win with this card that I really prefer is using Zedruu the Greathearted or some similar donate effect to donate Jin-Gitaxias (and however many Thought Reflections you've decided to put into play) and watch your opponent mill himself via card draw. Using Zedruu's card draw plus Solitary Confinement, your opponent can't really utilize the benefits you're giving him. Your pick of a Jester's Cap type effect can be used beforehand to remove any possible graveyard recycling.

Terribly inefficient way to do things, really, but it's an amazing 'win more' feeling if you can pull it off.

posts.post_content:
T1: [Quest for Ancient Secrets](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quest for Ancient Secrets)  
T2: [Jace's Erasure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace's Erasure)  
T3: [Swiftfoot Boots](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swiftfoot Boots)  
T4: [Quicksilver Amulet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quicksilver Amulet)  
T5: Tap 4 and Quicksilver Amulet for [Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur) and Tap 1 to equip Swiftfoot Boots to Jin-Gitaxias  
T6 and on: Watch as opponent cries and can't do anything. They mill 1 Card during your UUD, and 7 Cards at your End Phase. When you're library shrinks too much, use Quest for Ancient Secrets. Have a few Cancels or Mana Leaks, etc to stop you're opponent's 1 single card from ruining your strategy.

posts.post_content:
i'm very mixed about this guy; his third ability is absolutely amazing, but i don't find his first two to be of much use, and his cmc is hilariously high.  
my idealized version of this card is:   
8 cmc  
same third ability  
2/6 p/t  
  
you can get him out a a little earlier, and the higher toughness means he stays around longer  
  
still pretty good  
  
4/5
